title: Miso Noodle Soup With Vegetables
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Miso Noodle Soup With Vegetables a try. For $2.87 per serving, this recipe covers 13% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Watching your figure? This dairy free recipe has 364 calories, 20g of protein, and 15g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 6. This recipe from thefamilydinnerbook.com has 11 fans. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 4 minutes. If you have cooking vegetables, chicken stock, udon noodles, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the eggs you could follow this main course with the Rose Levy Beranbaum's Chocolate Tomato Cake with Mystery Ganache as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 47%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Miso Noodle Soup with Mixed Vegetables and Paneer, Udon Miso Noodle Soup, and Miso Noodle Soup with Edamame.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.
